definition: to give a new lease of life/to reconstruct/to reform/to rework/to recycle/to reproduce (copies, or offspring)/restoration/restructuring
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
your favor amounts to being given a new lease on life (idiom)

sentences.english: Today we are at the beginning of the next chapter of the reinvention of personal transportation.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们正站在再造个人交通新篇章的开始。

sentences.english: Assess the scope of the reengineering project.
sentences.chinese: 估计项目再造工程的范围。

sentences.english: They must be able to reproduce a build from bare iron at will.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须能够随意地重头开始再造一个构建。

sentences.english: Business Process Reengineering(BPR)is known as revolutions in business management area.
sentences.chinese: 企业业务流程再造被誉为工商管理的一次革命。

sentences.english: In 1879 de Lesseps tried to recreate his success in Panama.
sentences.chinese: 1879年，雷赛布试图在巴拿马再造辉煌。

sentences.english: Think of this as an opportunity to reinvent yourself.
sentences.chinese: 把这想成是再造自我的一个机会。

sentences.english: Cases of neolarynx reconstruction under acupuncture anesthesia combining with drugs were performed from 1992 to 1995.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍50例针药结合麻醉下行新喉再造术。

sentences.english: Objective Try to find an effective method creating auriculocephalic angle in auricle reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨耳郭再造术中颅耳角成形的一种有效方法。

sentences.english: These pillows allow you to recreate a Brooklyn street in your home.
sentences.chinese: 这些枕头能让你在自己家里再造出一条布鲁克林大街。

sentences.english: You are equbest friend in time.
sentences.chinese: 再造人卡辛来得正是时刻。

sentences.english: The second chapter analyzes the operation flow reforger of RPR&IDC .
sentences.chinese: 第二章对户证管理业务流程再造进行了分析。

sentences.english: The Shipyard has pioneered an environmentally safe method of deactivating and recycling nuclear-powered ships.
sentences.chinese: 造船厂，摸索了环境安全的方法再造失核动力船舶。

sentences.english: I want to do that again.
sentences.chinese: 我希望能再造一家这样的公司。

sentences.english: The plan that we should build another lad building was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该再造一个实验楼的方案很好。

sentences.english: Management may decide to extract and reengineer some critical component only.
sentences.chinese: 管理层可能决定只提取并再造工程某个关键组件。

sentences.english: The second toe of her left foot was transplanted to reconstruct the digit onto the stump of her forearm.
sentences.chinese: 取患者左足第二趾移植于前臂残端再造手指。

definition: to create/to build/to develop/to forge (of metal)
to be reborn/to regenerate/to be a second so-and-so (famous dead person)/recycling/regeneration
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to restore (sth) to (its) former condition/to recover from illness/recovery
a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
